result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon L. Paisley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#2

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

10:52 Defendant Shannon L. Paisley in court with certified student counsel Lynn McMullin.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2. probation 2 years each count; concurrent. McMullin and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2; McMullin stipulates to factual basis to support conviction.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#1 and Ct#2. Froelich and McMullin  address sentencing. Court: S/W 2 years probation on Ct#1 and Ct#2; concurrent. conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on April 24, 2017 at 10:15 am.

04:00 Defendant Shannon L. Paisley in court. Atty Liesl Nelson appears via phone for the defendant. Sean E. Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant has been authorized, court withdraws request for warrant. Set for plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 24, 2017 at 10:15 am.

9:47  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court with Lynne McMullin student.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear.  Froelich requests a bench warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.

4:07 Defendant Shannon L. Paisley in court with certified student counsel Lynn McMullin.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: motions to impeach defendant and witness. Atty Froelich gives argument for motions. McMullin gives argument. Court: rules #1,3,4 convictions can be used for impeachment for the Def. rules  #1-3,5 convictions can be used for impeachment of the witness. Set for trial and 1 case a head of this.

10:18 Defendant Shannon L. Paisley not in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan: requests a bench warrant based on non appearance. Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter.
